text:
PM Narendra Modi hails saints for breaking caste barriers PM Narendra Modi hails saints for breaking caste barriers Calling Ramakrishna the saint of social harmony, the PM said that he broke mental barriers between religions and between castes. By: Express News Service | New Delhi | Published:February 22, 2017 1:37 am 
Prime Minister Narendra Modi , who has been busy campaigning in Uttar Pradesh, on Tuesday addressed the inauguration event of the seven-day long ‘Sri Ramakrishna Vachanamrita Satram’ being held in Tiruvalla, Kerala, and hailed saints for their role in maintaining social harmony. 
Addressing the gathering via video-conferencing, he said that the teachings of the saints are relevant even today as “we are confronted with people who use religion, caste to divide and create animosity”. Lauding Narayana Guru, a saint and social reformer from a “backward caste” in transforming Kerala, 
Calling Ramakrishna the saint of social harmony, the PM said that he broke mental barriers between religions and between castes. “His teachings are particularly relevant to us today, when we are confronted with people who use religion, caste to divide and create animosity,” said Modi.
